Fields.DialogueText: *BOOM*
What was that?
You, stop! What's going on out here?
We're engaged with a group of Morganas!
And nobody thought to inform the captain of the ship? Or even to sound the klaxon?
I repeat, what's going on out here?
Um, I, well...
Yeah, that's right! Take your best shot, you overhyped junk heaps! We can take whatever you've got!
Ah.
@BATTLE
That was pretty fun, eh, Captain? I mean, I've had better, but it was a good wake-me-up.

Fields.MenuText: That wasn't okay, McDougal. I'm the captain, not you.
I've got to admit, it was a little fun.
Next time you give my crew an order without my knowledge, I'm sending you to the brig.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I'm the ship. Which I think outranks you. What's a captain without a ship?
I'm glad to hear you say that. I was worried you wouldn't have the stomach to keep up with me.
Oh, someone's trying to put the scary face on. Well, you're going to have to try harder than that with me, hun.
In a calmer mood. In the future, sound the alarm. It's there for a reason.
I have an iron stomach. Just don't start a fight without me next time.
I'm not trying to scare you, McDougal. I'm just hoping you'd rather be a team player than a thorn in my side.
I'll think about it. See ya around, Cap.
You're out... seriously?
Well... we already served the slices we had prepared today, and...
Don't give me that! I know you've got some sort of stockpile. Don't make me come back there!

Fields.MenuText: What's going on here?
For the love of God, give her whatever she wants.
Making some more trouble here, McDougal?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing, Captain. Isn't that right? There's no need for the Captain to get involved, right?
You heard the Captain. Make it quick. Before I get angry.
Trouble? I don't know the meaning of the word. We're just having a nice chat.
Uh, uh, um, no?
Exactly. So you can be on your way.
But... uh, we really don't...
I know you're full of it. Don't lie - you're not good at it!
... Depends on your definition of nice.
I heard that, you cockroach.
McDougal, I think we need to have a little talk. In private.
*ALARM*
I would, but I'm guessing that alarm means we've got Morganas to deal with. Unless you want to leave the crew to their own devices while we chat.
You're off the hook for now, but you can't avoid me forever.
I wouldn't dream of it, Cap.
Phew.
You better have it next time, ya little puke.
@BATTLE
Hey. McDougal, do you have a minute?
What? No. I'm not in the mood. Just get away. Leave me alone already.
Are you okay?
You just heard me say I wasn't in the mood.

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong?
That's really not the best evasive tactic I've ever come across.
You can open this door all the way or I can open it for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing. You know, private stuff.
Okay, then I'm sick. Cough, cough. See? Highly contagious.
Heh, good luck with that.
If you don't want to tell me, you don't have to. But I'm here if you need an ear.
You can't just say "cough."
I don't, cough, know what you mean. Cough.
Will you at least tell me what's bugging you?
Nngh... what the hell?
Okay. I don't care if you do have superhuman strength. I can get a crowbar.
Cheater.
Call me what you want. At least I'm not hiding from my problems.
Crap... we've got company.
You mean Morganas?
Does that answer your question?
Yeah. I hope you're in the mood for a fight.
Always.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You ordered me to present myself, Captain?
Yeah, we need to talk. Sit down.
I'll stand.
Okay...

Fields.MenuText: We need to talk about your attitude.
I've gotten a number of reports about you from the crew.
I think you're awesome.

Fields.DialogueText: My attitude? You got a problem with me, Cap?
Oh, yeah? If someone has a problem with me they should just come out and say it. That way we can settle it like sailors.
Huh? I mean, I am, but that's kind of out of the blue there, Captain.
Actually, I was going to ask you that. You seem to have something of a problem with authority.
I don't have a problem with authority. I just like having the freedom to do things my way.
That's the kind of thing I'm getting complaints about. The crew is scared of you. They trust you to keep them alive in battle, but otherwise...
What otherwise is there?
Well, screw 'em. Who needs 'em, anyway?
Well, I just wanted you to know I'm a huge fan before I started talking about all the complaints I'm getting from the crew.
Complaints? Who's complaining? Like you said, I'm awesome.
All I'm trying to say is that we need to work on your teamwork. That way we can all work together as a ship, instead of a bunch of people on a ship.
We need to work on it? So you're going to help me become a "constructive member" of this crew now?
If you'll let me.
... I guess. I mean, if it'll get you off my back, then it'll be worth it.
I guess that's a good first step.
*ALARM*
Ha! It's about time! C'mon, Captain, it's time to zip the lips and let loose the guns!
@BATTLE
Do you have it?
I, well, I...
Don't bother. I already know you don't have any. That's why my angry face is on. You know why else my angry face is on?
... Why?
Because I'm sure that if you're really out, then it's because you couldn't keep your grubby little fingers off it!
What? Let me go!
Puke it up or I'll shove my arm down your throat and get it myself!
McDougal.

Fields.MenuText: Put him down. Now.
Don't you think this might be part of the problem?
I'd like to see you talk your way out of this one.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, you don't understand! This guy-
... Maybe.
Why talk when I've got weapons?
Just let him go.
Fine.
Thanks, Captain. You're a lifesaver.
Grr...
You're dismissed. I'll deal with her.
I'd chase him, but I'm sensing a few Morganas nearby.
That's fortunate. Let's put some of that anger to good use.
That was the plan. Catch up.
@BATTLE
McDougal?
McDougal, are you firing guns down here?
Yup, I'm just blowing off some steam.

Fields.MenuText: Look at that. You actually set up dummies and everything.
Could you not? I was trying to catch some shuteye.
What's got you so stressed out?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, yeah. It makes it more fun, putting a face to the target.
Oh, I'm sorry, does li'l Captain need to rest? Should I get you a bottle of warm milk too?
It's a war. If you ain't stressed you ain't doing it right. Don't ask stupid questions.
Hmmm. That one looks kind of familiar.
Actually, I could go for some milk right now.
... Great, now I'm hungry.
I guess you have a point. And I guess everyone needs some way to relax.
Look, I don't want to be rude or whatever, but could you give me some privacy? There are some things a girl likes to do alone.
*ALARM*
I would, but I'm guessing we're going to need to deal with some Morganas.
Shooting practice is shooting practice. Target doesn't make much of a difference.
@BATTLE
Unless they fire back.
It's a tradeoff, Cap. Those targets I don't have to replace.
Hey, Captain.
... What's going on?
Okay, McDougal, I hope you have some free time.
For... what, exactly?

Fields.MenuText: We're going to track down that guy from the cafeteria and teach him a lesson.
We're going to work on your teamwork skills.
You want to start a fight?

Fields.DialogueText: If you're serious, then I'll need a second to load my big guns.
Oh, that? It's not really that important, is it?
You can color me intrigued, Captain. Tell me more.
Whoa, you can calm down. It was a joke. We really need to start working on your teamwork skills.
If you don't want the crew to rise up and mutiny, it is.
I... actually don't know why I'm so surprised by that reaction.
You clearly don't know me very well.
Well, you can put the teeth away. We're actually going to work on your teamwork skills.
My first instinct is to say screw you, but I figure that's kind of what got me into this mess, right?
I'm glad to see you're learning.
Any chance I can push this off just a little longer?
Not unless you have a really good reason.
How about a couple Morganas headed our way?
Nice try, but I'm not that gullib-
*ALARM*
You were saying?
We'll pick this up later.
Yeah, yeah, that's a future problem. Presently, we got punks to fight.
@BATTLE
Okay, so how is this teamwork training going to work, huh?
Well, I figure we should start with your feelings toward me.
Ha! Don't flatter yourself, Cap. You're not my type.

Fields.MenuText: I was referring to your animosity towards me.
Oh, you mean you're not in love with me? I may cry myself to sleep tonight.
I'll keep that in mind, but that's not what I meant.

Fields.DialogueText: Ooh, "animosity." Big word, Captain.
Try not to cry too hard. We wouldn't want you to flood the ship.
Oh yeah? Then what did you mean?
It means your angry attitude toward me. I'll use smaller words next time.
At least they'll be tears of happiness.
You know what I meant, unless you've taken one too many hard shots to the bridge.
Haha, very funny. Just tell me what we're going to do.
I'm thinking we can start with some trust exercises. Maybe doing something you enjoy together.
You know what I really enjoy?
*ALARM*
Do you just sense them coming and then time it just right?
Don't overthink it, Cap.
@BATTLE
This was the best you could come up with, Captain?
I figured some shooting practice would be the perfect chance to bond a little.
Well, it was a horrible idea.

Fields.MenuText: No. Your uniform is a horrible idea.
You just have a bad attitude. You need to work with me if you want to see results.
If this is so bad, then just come up with something better.

Fields.DialogueText: That's just a lie. Not even worth a response.
Maybe I don't want to see results. Maybe I like my bad attitude.
I will. When you stop distracting me with nonsense.
But, seriously, all you've done here is take one of my favorite pastimes and make it feel like work.
Fine. Let's go, then.
Why, where are you taking me?
We're going to do something I know you'll enjoy.
We're going to go find a Morgana.
@BATTLE
Hell yeah! That was more like it!
I thought a little violence might cheer you up.
It's no fun if you don't get to destroy something!
I suppose I can't argue with a destroyer about that.
Now, if the crew were game for some live fire exercises...
I can almost guarantee you they wouldn't be.
Hmph. Milksops.
Grr...
I'm aware you're glaring at me, if you were wondering. It gives me strength.
I hate you right now.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you're just saying that.
Doesn't matter, I'm the captain. You have to follow my orders.
Enh. The bitter tears of my subordinates just make me stronger.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you die.
Salt in the scrape.
Hate. So much hate. Respect. But hate.
Oh, uh, McDougal... I'm sorry, we're out again...
Of course you are.
McDougal.
I'm not here because of that. I came here to tell you that... that I'm...
Huh?
I'm sorry, all right?
For?
Grr... For scaring you, and pulling you by your collar, and threatening to wear your entrails as a hat.
Wear my what as a hat?
Oh, did I not say that one out loud? Well I'm sorry for thinking it then.
Well... I uh, accept your apology.
Great... I'm so relieved, or whatever.
We done here, Captain?
Yes, you did a very good job.
Whatever. Let's go find something to blow a hole into before I undo it.
@BATTLE
Captain, we're getting surrounded.
What? Why isn't an alarm going off?
Wait for it.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: You have to stop doing that.
It's like you can see the future.
I wish you could teach me to do that.

Fields.DialogueText: You'll have to make me.
Maybe I can. Who really knows everything Belles can do?
I'd be happy to. If you ever become a Belle.
But that's not important. I came here to tell you that the force is pretty massive. We might have some trouble taking them down.
You saying we should run?
Don't make me punch you. I never run. I'm saying if you want to win, then you'll listen to me.
My instinct says no, but... just don't kill us.
Follow my lead and you won't have to find out. Trust is a two way street, Cap. I've got this.
@BATTLE
Why would it be necessary?
Won't be necessary.
And fix the damn alarm! It's pointless if I have to be the one listening for those uglies.
Ahem.
Am I here for my reward? Or is it more of a commendation?
You did good, McDougal...

Fields.MenuText: ... but don't get full of yourself.
... but the most I can offer you is a simple "thank you."
... but I could've done better.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be whatever I want to be. And right now I'm feeling pretty cocky.
Well, if that's all you've got, I guess I'll take it.
Oh, a little competition. I like it. Maybe we can start trading off command until one of us loses?
So there wouldn't be a winner until the ship is destroyed?
I didn't say it was a perfect plan.
Well, on another note, I've been thinking lately.
I'll get the aspirin.
Very funny, but I was thinking about something you said before the fight. If I want you to trust me, I have to trust you.
Hold that thought... a few Morganas are headed our way. Not as many as before, so it shouldn't be an issue for us.
Then let's take these guys down quick. We can finish talking after.
Now you're speaking my language, Cap.
@BATTLE
McDougal, are you in there?
Oh, Captain, please come in. Take a seat.
Uh, thanks...

Fields.MenuText: Your room is a lot cleaner than I would've imagined.
Why are you acting weird?
But I don't want to bother you if you're busy.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I try to do my best to keep my room shipshape.
... Weird? You try'na say something?
No, I'm not busy at all. Please, I insist.
Oh, I should make you something to drink. Is tea okay, or would you prefer something harder?
That's not necessary, McDougal, really. I just wanted to finish what I was saying before.
Oh, right. You were talking about trusting me.
Exactly... I realized that I've been trying to force you to trust me by making you do things. Which is a little counterproductive, when you think about it.
I've been doing my damndest to make it that way.
Yeah, so I was thinking that I should start by trusting you.
Mhmmmm.
So I figured I'd give you some responsibility.
What do you mean?
A little role reversal. Let you give a few orders.
Heheheheh... you're gonna regret that, Cap.
That was the fastest I've ever seen something turn from cordial and inviting to creepy and frightening.
All right, then.
Don't worry about it yet. More tea?
Are you ready for the magic, Captain?
Let's pretend I am.
Excellent.
All right, I'm in charge now, everyone! You all have to listen to me!

Fields.MenuText: That's not quite what I meant, McDougal.
Yeah, everybody, what she said.
I've got to trust... I've got to trust...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, so you don't trust me after all?
Thanks for having my back, Captain.
Don't overreact. I'm not going power hungry right away.
Just carry on.
Now, everyone, as my first order, we're going to hunt down a Morgana and kick some ass! How's that sound?
*APPLAUSE*
Well, come on, let's get going already.
You know we were already fighting the Morganas anyway. That wasn't much of a first order.
Hey, before, we were just letting them come to us - we were playing defensive. Now we're going on the offense.
Maybe the best offense is a good defense.
I don't know who told you that, but they were wrong.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Behold - going on the offensive.
That... is certainly what I'm beholding, yes.
No snark.
@BATTLE
Where did that last Morgana go? Grr...
She ran off after we beat her. That happens more than I prefer it to.
Yeah, but we should've been right behind it. I wanted to send it straight to the depths.

Fields.MenuText: And you thought going in the opposite direction would accomplish that?
Well, I hate to say it, but I think it got away.
Oh, is that it there?

Fields.DialogueText: The opposite direction? What are you talking about?
Not possible! I'm an excellent hunter. Nothing gets away from me.
Where? Oh, is that it? No... but it can't be far.
I'm pretty sure it went east when we started heading west.
I'm telling you, it's nearby. Licking it's wounds. I'm going to find it, and then you'll see.
All right, if you're so certain. I'll leave you to it.
Thank you.

Fields.MenuText: Just let me know when you've given up.
You're welcome.
If you need me you know where to find me.

Fields.DialogueText: Just get out already! You'll throw off my focus!
What you waiting for? Get out and let me get back to the hunt.
Don't worry about that. You'd just be in the way.
I'm pretty sure it went east when we started heading west.
Never found the Morgana, huh?
Shut up.
So you're just giving up?
I'm not giving up. I'm just putting it on the back burner and pursuing other interests.
I see.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like giving up.
Sounds very mature.
You're full of it.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't give up. Say it again. I dare you.
Well, I'm a mature adult. I'm glad you can recognize that.
If by "it" you mean maturity and leadership skills, then yes. Yes, I am.
You know, it's okay to admit you can't do something.
I'm sorry, did you say something?
What's that?
What's what?
Is that a grenade?
Do you think I'm giving up?
No.
Good. Then Mr. Contingency-Plan can go back in the bag.
Captain, we've got Morganas to the north.
And those would be the other interests I was talking about.
Great. Let's just hope Mr. Contingency-Plan can stay in the bag for this fight.
@BATTLE
Right. Okay.
Captain, you're with me!
Huh?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a little busy here.
Well, okay, I guess...
Is it time for some fun?

Fields.DialogueText: Doesn't matter. I'm bringing you with me.
You're too slow. Come on!
For me, at least.
Hey, hey, hey, no need to drag me by the collar!
Then pick up the pace. We're running out of time.
Running out of time for what?
Before-
*ALARM*
Dammit! Before that!
What's going on, McDougal? Were you trying to race the Morganas or something?
No, nothing like that. They're just annoying and always popping up when they're least wanted.
I'll explain later.
@BATTLE
McDougal, you wanted to see me?
Yes, please come in.
Whoa, look at all these guns! You've got an arsenal in here!
Thanks so much, Captain. I'm glad you're impressed.

Fields.MenuText: Stop being so polite. It's weird.
It's more fear than anything.
I just hope they're not all for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm just being a good host. Oh, I should get you something to drink.
Don't worry, Captain. The only ones who should be afraid are our enemies.
Raring to go? I like it, Captain. I'm more than happy to share.
No, please don't.
What are all these guns for, anyway? Are you stocking up for the next war after this one?
Nope. I'm just planning on finishing one close to home.
... Don't tell me we're headed for the mess hall.
You read my mind, Captain.
*ALARM*
But looks like we've got some action to deal with first. Grab your favorite and let's take down some Morganas!
So many to choose from...
@BATTLE
All right, you no good, freedom-hating crapweasel! This has gone on long enough!
Waaaah, watch where you're aiming that thing!
I'll aim it wherever I damn well please.
Captain! A little help, please?

Fields.MenuText: McDougal, take it down a notch or two.
Sorry, trust exercise. I'm her backup this time.
Help you, or her? I'm still unsure who's in the right here.

Fields.DialogueText: I will not! I'll crank it all the way up if that's what it takes to get this guy to talk!
Damn straight you are, Cap. Let's work this guy over until he squeals like the pig he is.
Well, I am, obviously! Seriously, Captain? I thought we were working on our trust.
Whoa, that's, uh, that's the alarm, right? Looks like you'd better go use those big, scary guns on the Morganas instead of on me.
Well, I guess we can't interrogate you and deal with the Morganas at the same time.
That's a good point.
But I ain't leaving you here to get rid of evidence. C'mon, you're coming with us!
What? You're bringing me out to the front lines!?
Bet you wished you had just talked now, huh?
Just make sure you don't kill him, all right, McDougal?
@BATTLE
Awright, take me through the galley or I start blowing holes in you.
You hear me? I'm not joking around here.

Fields.MenuText: I think he's gone into shock.
She really isn't. I would not want to be in your shoes right now.
Just try not to make a mess. That's all I ask.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I think a bullet wound or two would fix that.
Hear that? Even the captain knows you're in for a world of hurt.
No promises. It's really all down to this guy.
Okay, okay, follow me. But you're not going to find what you're looking for. We're really, honestly out.
We'll see about that. Move!
Here you go, see? No pie. We're clean out.
Pie? That's what this is all about?
Apple pie, specifically. We're in the mess hall. What else would we be talking about, Captain?
Pie is the first thing we run out of whenever it's on board. She just doesn't get here fast enough.
Bull. I know you're hoarding some for yourself, you greedy little cockroach.
We've got Morganas again.
You got away with it this time, but I'll be back.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
Another Morgana attack? What is going on?
What do you mean?
It seems like groups of Morganas are attacking us one after another lately. I can hardly breathe between battles.
Don't be stupid. They're not attacking us. I gave a standing order to immediately engage any Morganas that get in our sights.
So you mean we're the ones starting all these fights?
Exactly. Ass-kicking after ass-kicking. That's how I like to spend my days.

Fields.MenuText: That's insane, McDougal. We have limited resources, and we have to think strategically.
It's not the worst idea in the world, but I think we need to take a break for a while.
I like the way you think. The more Morganas we take down now, the weaker they'll be later.

Fields.DialogueText: Where did all that trust go, Captain? Give me a little credit.
I'll take a break when I'm dead. Which isn't happening in the foreseeable future.
Great minds think alike, Cap. If we keep working together, the Morganas don't stand a chance.
Enough talking. We've got a battle to win!
@BATTLE
McDougal, can we talk?
Oh, Captain. Please come in.
Uh, I'd rather not.
Why not? Is something the matter?
Yeah, you always act really weird when I go in your room.
I'm not being weird! I'm just hosting. I'm being polite.

Fields.MenuText: Since when are you polite?
You just seem like a different person.
I mean... I guess you have a point.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always polite!
Well, I assure you, I'm the same McDougal I've always been.
See? So there's nothing to feel weird about.
I just don't want you to feel like you have to put on airs for me.
I never put on airs. I only act how I want to act. Not even you can change that.
That's what I like to hear from you.
Now, if that's everything... I'm sensing a few Morganas nearby that I'd really like to punch a few holes in.
Lead the way.
@BATTLE
McDougal, where are you going?
I'm going to wait outside the ship.
I'm making sure everything gets resupplied. And I mean everything.

Fields.MenuText: You know you can't get too far away from the ship, right?
I have a feeling you have something specific in mind.
Isn't there something more constructive you could do with your time?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sitting right outside the ship. I'm just going to inspect the packages as they're loaded onto the ship.
What, can you read my mind now? I'll have to be careful what I think around you.
This is the most constructive thing I could be doing. Trust me.
All right, well, I guess if I need you I'll know where to find you.
Don't worry. The closest Morgana is nowhere near us. Though I wouldn't mind heading that way when we're done here.
I'll tell you what. If you actually mark down everything that comes onto the ship and make sure we're completely resupplied, we can head that way.
Deal. It's like shooting two birds with one bullet.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You were saying?
Damn it! These rats are getting every barrel I can find!
Um, what are you doing, McDougal?
What? Shut up! You're going to blow my cover!
Ow, let go. What are you talking about?
I've been following this box since it got onboard. If my suspicions are right, it'll lead me to all the answers I need.
What's in the box?
Pies. All sorts of delicious pies.

Fields.MenuText: We're still on this? Seriously?
Ah, so we're finally going to solve the Great Pie Caper.
Oh, this again. Have fun, I guess. Just don't kill anyone.

Fields.DialogueText: I will never be off this! Not until I finally get some apple pie.
We? Glad to see you're still on board.
Where do you think you're going? You're still in this with me. Stay down!
You know, if you want some pie so badly, why don't you just take one straight from the box?
And do exactly what that hideous waste of space is doing? I refuse to sink to his level.
I guess you have a point.
Plus, it would be like cheating. And if anything can improve the delicious taste of apple pie, it's the satisfaction that comes with earning it.
I think you might be a little too obsessed with this.
*ALARM*
Eeek, how did I not see that coming? I must've been too focused on this to sense the Morganas.
Are you going to keep trailing the box or are you going to come help with the Morganas?
You know the answer to that. Come on!
@BATTLE
Ah hah! See, Captain? I told you he was guilty!
What's going on? What are you doing here?
I tracked your footprints from the box of pies. It was simple to follow them straight to your room.
I-It's-it's not what you think.
That'd be a lot more convincing if your face wasn't covered in pie crust and there wasn't an empty tin in your lap.

Fields.MenuText: Let's hear what he has to say.
She's right. It's pretty obvious what happened here.
I'm kind of interested in hearing this "explanation" he has.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to hear him out, you can listen through the bars of his cell.
Obvious is an understatement. Now let's drag him to the brig. I hope you resist.
I've never been one for fiction.
Just... just please don't let her kill me, Captain.
Kill you? What are you, a moron? I just want to teach you a lesson. A few weeks in the brig oughta do just that.
Weeks?
Count your lucky stars she didn't say months. She really loves her pie.
Damn straight. Now let's get going.
*ALARM*
Oh, great. Looks like we've got Morganas headed this direction.
You head up. I'll join you after I get this guy in his cage.
Just make sure he gets there in one piece.
Heh, no promises.
Oh, hell...
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me?
Yeah, I wanted to talk. Come in.
What's this about?
You've been giving the orders for a while now.
Yeah, I have. And it's going pretty good, if I do say so myself.
And I feel like some trust has grown between us.
... I can't argue with that. You're okay.
I'm happy to hear it. So you're okay if I start giving the orders again?
Fine, but I retain the right to ignore the dumb ones.
That's the best I'm going to get, isn't it?
You know it.
Heh. Deal.
Seriously, we are an awesome team. I mean, amazingly so.
You can deny it if you like, but it just makes you look kind of stubborn.

Fields.MenuText: I mean... I guess.
I am kind of stubborn. But, yeah, a few bumps along the way just make it more interesting.

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds like someone wants to start an argument. I admire your gumption, Captain - even if you can't win.
And that's why we work so well together.
